author: Guest Contributor
title: The Case for Retaliatory Strikes Against Iran | The Gateway Pundit | by Guest Contributor
text: In a recent and tragic turn of events, three U.S. soldiers lost their lives, and 25 others sustained injuries in lethal drone attacks targeting U.S. bases in Jordan. These ruthless assaults were orchestrated by Iran-backed militias operating within the territories of Syria and Iraq. This incident comes on the heels of previous Iran-backed Houthi attacks on ships in the Red Sea, including an assault on a U.S. Navy destroyer . These actions are all interconnected within the broader context of Iran‚Äôs shadow war against the United States and its allies, particularly Israel and Saudi Arabia. Now, both within and outside the U.S. government, there are growing voices pressuring the Biden administration to punish Tehran by launching retaliatory strikes directly against Iran. The October 7th Hamas attack on Israel was the first step in uncovering how Iran threatens the region by escalating tensions and promoting sectarian violence. From terrorist activity in Israel to Syria, Yemen, Lebanon, and the Red Sea, all roads lead back to Iran‚Äôs Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC). Established in 1979 shortly after the Iranian Revolution, the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) was formed to safeguard the newly established Islamic Republic by creating a military force dedicated to revolutionary ideology rather than the traditional Iranian military associated with the Shah. The IRGC operates independently, reporting directly to Iran‚Äôs Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, granting it substantial autonomy and influence beyond the regular armed forces and civilian government. The IRGC‚Äôs official functions include military defense to protect Iran‚Äôs territorial integrity and maintaining internal security by suppressing dissent while upholding revolutionary ideology. Beyond Iran‚Äôs border, the IRGC is responsible for conducting revolutionary ideological outreach and engaging in foreign military operations through the Quds Force . The latter includes both covert and overt operations abroad, supporting regional proxies such as Hezbollah, Hamas, and the Houthis. The Quds Force provides logistical, financial, and military support to Shia militias and terrorist organizations, serving as Tehran‚Äôs regional extensions. This further advances its political and security interests while destabilizing neighboring countries. The IRGC was designated as a Foreign Terrorist Organization (FTO) by the Trump administration in October 2017. This designation persists under the Biden administration . U.S. lawmakers have also encouraged the EU to similarly designate the IRGC as a Foreign Terrorist Organization (FTO) for its support of Russian war crimes in Ukraine. Now that Israel is waging war on Hamas and the U.S. has launched retaliatory strikes against Houthi targets in Yemen, these terrorist militias are seeing the consequences of their actions. While liberals are calling for a ceasefire, many conservatives are demanding harsher reprisals. Regardless of how some Americans feel about Israeli-Palestinian tensions and Tehran‚Äôs challenge to regional security by backing militias in proxy wars, it is irrefutable that the Houthi attacks in the Red Sea are direct national security concerns challenging U.S. interests in the Middle East. Apart from the regime‚Äôs aggression and state-sponsored terrorism, Tehran‚Äôs violation of nuclear non-proliferation agreements poses a danger to global security. Protecting American interests in the Middle East by standing up to Iran would promote stability and peace in the region. At the same time, the U.S. must support traditional allies like Israel and Saudi Arabia, preventing the spread of Islamic extremism and its threat to Western values. Critics of the Biden administration are demanding strong leadership and decisive action in confronting Iranian aggression. Senator Tom Cotton has charged that the Biden administration‚Äôs appeasement of Iran has enabled further terrorist activity, leading to the deaths of U.S. soldiers. Senator Lindsey Graham feels that the U.S. response must go beyond sanctions and diplomacy, which have proved ineffective over the past 40 years. In a speech harkening back to calls to ‚Äúbomb Iran‚Äù after the seizure of the US embassy in Tehran in 1979, he suggested that the U.S. should bomb IRGC headquarters and other strategic positions in Iran, as well as the oil fields that provide income to the regime. Senator Graham said, ‚ÄúThey have a Revolutionary Guard headquarters you can see from space. Blow it off the map .‚Äù Iran‚Äôs backing of terrorism, both financially and militarily, directly fuels geopolitical instability. This, in turn, poses a significant threat to the United States and the international rules-based order. Trending: Trump Responds to Rumors About Red Marks on His Hand (VIDEO) A strategic move, such as targeting oil wells, not only cripples Tehran‚Äôs financial resources and its ability to support terrorist organizations but also undermines China‚Äôs global ambitions by removing a source of low-cost oil. Opting for direct military action against Iran would not only send a strong message against the murder of U.S. personnel abroad but also serve as a clear warning to groups like Hezbollah, Hamas, and the Houthis that they could face similar consequences in the future. Dr. Antonio Graceffo, PhD, China MBA, is an economist and national security analyst with a focus on China and Russia. He is a graduate of American Military University.

author: @KLTV7
title: Lufkin Marine Corps prepares for trip to Kerr County to aid in flood recovery
text:
LUFKIN, Texas (KTRE) - Members of the Lufkin Marine Corps League are preparing to head to Kerrville to assist in the clean-up and recovery process after devastating floods that left over 100 dead and even more still missing.
The team said although they are no longer on active or reserve military duty, that doesn‚Äôt mean they are idle.
‚ÄúAs Marines and other military veterans, it‚Äôs part of our mission," Brian Crews said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Marines lifelong and our mission is to help in any way, any possible, any way we can. Anyone, anywhere. It‚Äôs just what we do.‚Äù
The team plans to leave at 5 a.m., bringing with them a command trailer full of GPS, communications, and first aid equipment as well as drinking water and rescue equipment.
Copyright 2025 KTRE. All rights reserved.

author: JANA WIERSEMA jwiersema@news-gazette.com
title: Urbana police seek tips on Brookstone Court shooting | News | news-gazette.com
text: URBANA ‚Äî The Urbana Police Department is seeking information about a shooting. At around noon on Thursday, police responded to multiple reports of shots fired near the 1200 to 1300 block of Brookstone Court. Officers found at least four shell casings near the entrance to Hamilton on the Park Apartments, located at 1201 Brookstone Ct., and gunfire struck a window at the apartment complex's office, the department said. No victims have come forward, as of Thursday afternoon. "Presently, there is no clear indication of a motive or intended target in this incident," UPD officials said. "Despite the proximity to Booker T. Washington School, there is currently no evidence to suggest the involvement of the school or any students in the shooting." The police urge anyone with additional information about the incident or video footage to contact them at 217-384-2320. Arrangements can be made for information to be shared privately. Individuals who wish to remain anonymous can submit tips to Crime Stoppers at 217-373-8477 (TIPS), [373tips.com](http://373tips.com), or through the "P3 Tips" mobile app. Crime Stoppers offers cash rewards of up to $5,000 for tips leading to an arrest in any homicide case, $2,500 for tips leading to an arrest in a felony crime involving a firearm, and up to $1,000 for tips resulting in the arrest of the person(s) responsible for any other crime.

author: N.S.
title: Cuidado con viajar con equipaje extra: c√≥mo colocarlo y sanciones por no hacerlo bien | Canarias7
text: Seguro que te ha pasado. Te vas de vacaciones con una maleta y una mochila, y cuando tienes que volver, casi tienes el doble de cosas para guardar. Pero el problema es a la hora de meterlo en el coche, esos bultos de m√°s pueden suponer algunas complicaciones. Si algo hay que tener claro es que ning√∫n objeto debe ir suelto dentro del veh√≠culo, es decir, con los pasajeros. Esto quiere decir que no se deben llevar mochilas, bolsas u otros bultos en los asientos traseros. Todo el equipaje debe ir en el maletero y bien sujeto, con una separaci√≥n f√≠sica respecto a los ocupantes. S√≥lo as√≠ se puede garantizar que nada sale proyectado en caso de frenazo o accidente de tr√°fico.¬´Viajar con un simple ordenador port√°til de 2,2 kg puede resultar especialmente peligroso. Su impacto puede ser similar a chocar contra un jabal√≠ de 85 kg, si el coche frena a una velocidad de 50 km/h. Si la velocidad es de 90 km/h, la situaci√≥n es todav√≠a m√°s impactante, ya que se asemeja a colisionar contra un oso pardo de 275 kg, seg√∫n avisan desde la Direcci√≥n General de Tr√°fico (DGT). Lamentablemente, no damos la merecida importancia que se merece al simple hecho de colocar el equipaje correctamente ni le dedicamos el tiempo necesario¬ª, afirma Guillermo Rodr√≠guez , Market Manager Transporte y Movilidad de Norauto Espa√±a.En este sentido, los bultos m√°s pesados y grandes deben ir en la parte baja y central del maletero, lo m√°s pr√≥ximo al eje. Se aconseja equilibrar el peso por todo el maletero y repartirlo correctamente. Si las maletas llevan ruedas, se aconseja ponerlas hacia arriba para que no rueden por el maletero.Es muy frecuente que los veh√≠culos SUV o 4x4 ofrezcan conexi√≥n entre el maletero y la zona de pasajeros. Siempre hay que llevar la bandeja cerrada y se aconseja contar con una separaci√≥n f√≠sica como puede ser una rejilla. Por supuesto, desde Norauto se se√±ala que es vital que el maletero cierre correctamente. Hay que recordar que la carga no puede caer bajo ning√∫n concepto a la carretera.Puede que el maletero no sea suficiente. En estos casos, es recomendable optar por diferentes soluciones de transporte seg√∫n lo que se vaya a llevar. As√≠, por ejemplo, se pueden utilizar cofres o maleteros de techo donde colocar ese equipaje extra o los cada vez m√°s empleados cofres de enganche, que c√≥modamente sujetos a la bola del enganche y bien se√±alizados seg√∫n la normativa de la placa V20, pueden ser una muy buena soluci√≥n de transporte adicional, afectando en menor medida a la aerodin√°mica del veh√≠culo. En todo momento se deben seguir los pasos indicados por el fabricante para su correcta instalaci√≥n. Igualmente, los objetos colocados dentro del maletero de techo deben repartirse de forma uniforme para equilibrar el peso.En este sentido, la instalaci√≥n de un enganche en el veh√≠culo puede ser una soluci√≥n muy eficaz, ya que no s√≥lo es muy √∫til para el transporte de bicicletas de forma c√≥moda con el correspondiente portabicicletas, sino tambi√©n para la instalaci√≥n de remolques y los mencionados cofres de enganche.Los objetos alargados y r√≠gidos pueden ir correctamente sujetos en la baca del coche (barras de techo). Sin embargo, desde Norauto se recuerda que si la carga transportada en la baca excede los l√≠mites de dimensiones establecidos reglamentariamente, la sanci√≥n puede ser hasta 500 euros de multa y la retirada de 4 puntos del carnet de conducir. Actualmente, el art√≠culo 15 del Reglamento General de Circulaci√≥n (RGC) establece que si la carga es divisible, s√≥lo puede sobresalir por la parte posterior hasta un 10% de la longitud del veh√≠culo. Si la carga es indivisible, puede hacerlo hasta un 15% de la longitud del veh√≠culo.En el caso de querer transportar bicicletas, se puede recurrir a un portabicicletas. Actualmente hay cuatro opciones y siempre se debe escoger aquella m√°s recomendable seg√∫n las necesidades individuales y tipo de veh√≠culo. Por un lado, est√° el portabicicletas de techo, perfecto para transportar de 1 a 4 bicicletas, debe ir sobre las barras de techo. Por otro lado, el de port√≥n trasero o de maletero permite el transporte de hasta tres bicis. Se fijan sobre el port√≥n trasero mediante cinchas. El portabicicletas de enganche o de bola puede ser suspendidos o de plataforma. R√°pidos y f√°ciles de instalar. Por √∫ltimo, los remolques son una buena opci√≥n cuando hay que transportar un elevado n√∫mero de bicicletas. Algunos remolques permiten llevar hasta siete bicicletas.Si por el contrario el coche no va lleno tambi√©n es recomendable tomar ciertas precauciones: abrochar los cinturones de los asientos traseros si no hay pasajeros, por ejemplo, sirve para ofrecer una mayor protecci√≥n y evitar que los bultos puedan salir proyectados atravesando los asientos. Tambi√©n se aconseja el uso de redes para fijar la carga.

author: Irishexaminer.com (digitaldesk@irishexaminer.com)
title: 'Unpredictable' Ulster attack will pose serious threat, insists Doris
text:
They might be nine points ahead of them in the United Rugby Championship standings, but Leinster back-row Caelan Doris has insisted that Ulster will pose a threat right across the board at the RDS on New Year‚Äôs Day (kick-off 5.15pm).
Despite some difficult results to date, Ulster will come into Monday‚Äôs clash with the URC pace-setters on the back of a tense 20-19 win over Connacht at Kingspan Stadium in Belfast last Friday week (December 22).
Before that, Dan McFarland‚Äôs charges bolstered their European Champions Cup prospects with a 31-15 pool stage triumph over a Racing 92 side that are currently being steered by former Leinster senior coach Stuart Lancaster.
Although Tipperary native Jake Flannery won‚Äôt be featuring for them on this occasion, the experienced Billy Burns does return at fly-half in an Ulster starting line-up that includes current Irish internationals Rob Herring, Iain Henderson, Stuart McCloskey and Tom O‚ÄôToole - as well as South African World Cup winner Steven Kitshoff.
While the eastern province overcame an early red card for Cian Healy to defeat Ulster in last season‚Äôs corresponding fixture on December 3, 2022, the visitors had initially seized upon their numerical advantage to lead by 19 points (22-3) during an incident-packed opening half in the RDS.
Doris appeared off the bench in this game and is well aware of what Ulster are capable of if they are afforded time and space on the pitch.
‚ÄúThey were impressive against Racing. I haven‚Äôt seen all of the Connacht game yet, but another good win. Their attack, we were looking at bits of it this morning, is very unpredictable. They sort of change direction quite a bit.
"John Cooney, in particular, at nine is very good at spotting opportunities down the short side or snipe opportunities,‚Äù Doris remarked at a Leinster media briefing on Thursday.
‚ÄúThey‚Äôve got a very strong set-piece, their scrum and their lineout is pretty impressive and is a weapon they have used quite a bit to good effect in the past. They have good poachers as well throughout. Nick Timoney has been impressive in that area.‚Äù
Though Leinster are currently on a run of nine straight victories across the URC and the Champions Cup since their opening round defeat to Glasgow Warriors in the former competition, there is still a sense that Leo Cullen‚Äôs men are searching for more consistency over 80 minutes within games in 2023/24.
From Doris‚Äô perspective, this is something that he and his colleagues in both the provincial and international environments are constantly striving for.
The fact that they had already played six games this season in advance of Jacques Nienaber finally taking up his post as senior coach in late November may explain why there is still scope for improvement within this Leinster side.
Yet Doris, who will feature against Ulster after being rested for the St Stephen‚Äôs Day victory over Munster at Thomond Park, is confident that things will start to click fully as the term progresses.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs what we‚Äôre always chasing down, both in Ireland and in here, an 80-minute performance. There have been plenty of examples of good stuff in a game, but never quite getting the 80-minute performance. It‚Äôs hard when you‚Äôre playing different quality opposition who are throwing different tricks at you,‚Äù Mayo native Doris added.
‚ÄúA big focus has been, regardless of what has gone before, whether it‚Äôs positive or negative, being present and playing what‚Äôs in front of you. As clich√©d as that is. That‚Äôs quite a focus. The more we train together under these new coaches, we‚Äôll get more cohesion and things will naturally come together a little bit better.‚Äù
J O'Brien; T O'Brien, L Turner, R Henshaw, R Russell; S Prendergast, J Gibson-Park; C Healy, D Sheehan, T Clarkson; J Jenkins, J Ryan; R Baird, W Connors, C Doris.
L Barron, J Boyle, M Ala'alatoa, J McCarthy, J van der Flier, L McGrath, H Byrne, J Conan.
W Addison; R Baloucoune, L Marshall, S McCloskey, J Stockdale; B Burns, J Cooney; S Kitshoff, R Herring, T O‚ÄôToole; K Treadwell, I Henderson; M Rea, S Reffell, N Timoney.
T Stewart, A Warwick, S Wilson, A O‚ÄôConnor, D Ewers, N Doak, M Lowry, J Postlethwaite.

author: El Tiempo / GDA
title: La historia de los mineros que encontraron la pepa de oro m√°s grande del mundo - Primera Hora
text: La historia de los mineros que encontraron la pepa de oro m√°s grande del mundo As√≠ viven sus descendientes. PUBLICIDAD Durante el siglo XIX, varios pa√≠ses experimentaron la ‚Äúfiebre del oro‚Äù, lo que caus√≥ que miles de personas arriesgaran sus vidas para trabajar en minas peligrosas con la esperanza de hacerse ricos. Australia fue uno de los principales focos de esta fiebre, destac√°ndose con el hallazgo de la pepita de oro m√°s grande del mundo. Este descubrimiento ocurri√≥ el 5 de febrero de 1869 en los yacimientos de oro de Victoria, Australia, espec√≠ficamente en la regi√≥n de Moliagul. Un d√≠a, los mineros John Deason y Richard Oates vieron una gran roca brillante que estaba incrustada en cuarzo, en la cuesta llamada Bulldog Gully. Relacionadas Cuando la sacaron, vieron que era una pepa de oro que pesaba casi 160 libras (72 kilogramos) y med√≠a cerca de 24 pulgadas (60 cent√≠metros) de largo, a la cual decidieron llamarla ‚ÄúWelcome Stranger‚Äù. Los hombres sab√≠an que se iban a volver ricos y, para facilitar su peso y venta, la pepita fue partida en pedazos. Descubierta el 5 de febrero de 1869 por los mineros John Deason y Richard Oates en Moliagul, Victoria, Australia, esta impresionante pepita pesaba 72 kg. Su hallazgo marc√≥ un hito en la historia de la fiebre del oro en Australia.‚Äî ùïµùñîùñìùñÜùñôùñçùñÜùñì ùïæùñìùñîùñú ùñÇùñéùñàùñê üÉèüê∫ (@JonathanStark27) [pic.twitter.com/kpe80wR7G4] [April 18, 2024] En ese entonces, John Deason y Richard Oates, recibieron 13,000 d√≥lares por el oro, una suma considerable para la √©poca. Si se vendiera hoy, valdr√≠a aproximadamente 2.7 millones de d√≥lares. Seg√∫n el medio ‚ÄúLa Naci√≥n‚Äù, Deason y Oates eran inmigrantes de Inglaterra y llegaron a Australia en 1853 y 1854, respectivamente. Se mudaron a Moliagul en 1862 y trabajaron en las minas durante siete a√±os antes de su gran descubrimiento. En un d√≠a normal de trabajo encontraron la pepa de Oro, la cual la llevaron a Dunolly, a 12 millas (20 kil√≥metros), para verificar su peso. Gracias al descubrimiento de Welcome Stranger en esa ciudad desencaden√≥ un auge inmobiliario y comercial. Sin embargo, cuando cesaron los descubrimientos de piedras preciosas, muchos edificios quedaron abandonados. Hoy en d√≠a, Moliagul exhibe una r√©plica de la pepita basada en los dibujos y relatos de la √©poca y un monumento marca el lugar del descubrimiento, atrayendo a turistas y entusiastas del oro. Tiempo despu√©s, en el 2019, se conmemoraron 150 a√±os del hallazgo en Cornualles, con la participaci√≥n de los descendientes de Deason y Oates. Suzie Deason. Una de las organizadoras, relat√≥ que frecuentemente le preguntan si es rica debido a su apellido. ‚ÄúLamentablemente, no lo soy y ni siquiera tenemos joyas hechas con la piedra‚Äù, coment√≥ a la BBC. ‚Äî OutletMinero (@Outletminero) [#DatoMinero]| La pepita de oro m√°s grande jam√°s encontrada fue el "Welcome Stranger", que se encuentra en Moliagul, Australia en 1869 por John Deason y Richard Oates. Su peso en bruto, es m√°s de 78 kg. [#Miner√≠aIncre√≠ble] [#Miner√≠aAsombrosa] [pic.twitter.com/w5mx104vX9] [November 28, 2022] Seg√∫n el mismo medio, actualmente, Moliagul ha cambiado dr√°sticamente, convirti√©ndose en una tranquila comunidad ganadera sin tiendas ni hoteles, y con solo unas pocas casas. A pesar de ello, sigue atrayendo a buscadores de oro, interesados en la regi√≥n conocida como el Tri√°ngulo de Oro. Sin embargo, la historia de Welcome Stranger mantiene viva la atracci√≥n por la zona. ‚ÄúLa gente viene hasta aqu√≠ a probar suerte y pasa d√≠as y d√≠as tratando de encontrar su fortuna. A√∫n quedan pepitas de un tama√±o considerable por aqu√≠, pero nada como Welcome Stranger‚Äù, explic√≥ Deason. Por √∫ltimo, Deason asegur√≥ que ‚ÄúLo llamamos fiebre del oro. Es una enfermedad, una adicci√≥n a buscar oro‚Äù, pues todav√≠a esta fiebre sigue viva en el coraz√≥n de aquellos que a√∫n se aventuran en busca de tesoros en Moliagul.
